intro: Restio fragilis, commonly known as the brittle restio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family, which includes many grass-like plants found in Mediterranean climates. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters. Restio fragilis is often found in coastal and sandy environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
